description.points: A step represents a progression level in your circuit. Each level defines a number of points to reach for the user to progress. For example, level 1 might require 100 points, level 2 might require 250 points, and so on.
description.actions: A step represents an action in your circuit. Each action defines a number of repetitions to perform for the user to progress. For example, action 1 might require 5 repetitions, action 2 might require 10 repetitions, and so on.

description.points: Manually add each point level. You can precisely define the number of points required for each level. For example, you could have levels at 100, 250, 500, 1000 points, etc.
description.actions: Manually add each action. You can precisely define the number of repetitions required for each action. For example, you could have actions at 5, 10, 20, 50 repetitions, etc.

description.points: Generate steps automatically with a predefined progression. You can choose the number of levels, start and maximum values, as well as the type of progression (linear, exponential or logarithmic).
description.actions: Generate steps automatically with a predefined progression. You can choose the number of actions, start and maximum values, as well as the type of progression (linear, exponential or logarithmic).

exponent.title: Progression intensity
exponent.description: Adjust the intensity of exponential progression. A higher exponent makes progression more difficult.
